a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Per capita fossil energy consumption vs. GDP per capita, 2022
Fossil energy consumption is the sum of primary energy from coal, oil and gas, measured in megawatt-hours.
Gross domestic product (GDP) is adjusted for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2024); Population based on various sources (2023); World Bank
Note: GDP data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices.
